{{cpp/io/basic_ostream/title|~basic_ostream}}
{{cpp/io/basic_ostream/navbar}}
{{ddcl| 
virtual ~basic_ostream();
}}

Destroys the {{tt|basic_ostream}} object. This destructor does not perform any operation on the underlying streambuffer ({{tt|rdbuf()}}): the destructors of the derived output streams such as {{lc|std::basic_ofstream}} and {{lc|std::basic_ostringstream}} are responsible for calling the destructors of the stream buffers.

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
#include &lt;sstream&gt;

void add_words(std::streambuf* p)
{
    std::ostream buf(p); // buf shares the buffer with s
    buf &lt;&lt; " is the answer";
} // calls the destructor of buf. p remains unaffected

int main()
{
    std::ostringstream s;
    s &lt;&lt; 42;
    add_words(s.rdbuf());
    s &lt;&lt; ".";
    std::cout &lt;&lt; s.str() &lt;&lt; '\n';
}
|output=
42 is the answer.
}}
